messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] four y.o.'s anguish
messages.msgSnippet: OH,,,,you guys,, I miss out on the best conversations because I poop out so early! That was so sweet Sandra. I also missed out on all the sperm talk and I m
messages.messageBody:
OH,,,,you guys,, I miss out on the best conversations because I poop out so early!
That was so sweet Sandra.
I also missed out on all the sperm talk and I'm bummed, not as fun reading it a day later, <pouting>
I'm such a morning person, damn!
Kelli
starsuncloud@... wrote:In a message dated 10/30/02 7:03:48 PM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< When I mentioned Keith holding him first, Kirby pulled off the breast with
his mouth open and milk still unswallowed and looked at my face with big
eyes. He listened to some more of the story, and he reached over and got
my
hand and kissed it.

He had never kissed my hand like that. I lay with him and rubbed his head
and he fell asleep.

I went and called Keith at work and said, "When you had Kirby in the
hospital
room, when he was born, what were you doing before I came in?"

He said, "Just talking to him. And kissing his hands and his feet." >>

Oh my gosh...I'm crying.
That was incredible Sandra.
Thank you for sharing it.

Ren
